result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Earl Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 141 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 141 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of supervision in 14CF2006.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Court advised the defendant that due to this Domestic Violence conviction, he may never possess a firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in court with attorney Brian C Hagner.  Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 2, 3 AND 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Statements made by:  Sebrenna S.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

received and filed.

COUNT 1:  CRIMINAL TRESPASS TO DWELLING, DOMESTIC ABUSE, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.14, 939.51(3)(a), 968.075(1)(a) , a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in court with attorney Brian C Hagner.  Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in custody.  Ryan T Sanson for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/09/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Attorney Brian C Hagner in court, defendant Raymond Earl Harris not in court, in custody.  Matthew Torbenson for Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant has picked up a new case.  Court ordered matter adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 3-3-2014 received and filed. (19 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Attorney Brian Hagner. 4377 W. Loomis Road Greenfield, WI  53220
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Scheduling Conference held.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 14CM551 and 14CF749 joined for the purpose of trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in custody.  Cynthia Davis for Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Information filed.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant as to Counts 2,3 and 4.  Defense will be filing a motion to dimiss as to Count 1.

Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Richard Pinter-West Allis Police Department Officer.  Court took judical notice of the defendant being out on bail regarding case #14CM551 at the time of this incident.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss Count 1 is argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Arraignment scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sebrenna S

Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Defendant Raymond Earl Harris in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case, this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defense moves to dismiss Count 1  for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss Count 1.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 3 & 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
